elements.title: Hank Goldberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Hank Goldberg (pictured) was dismissed from WIOD for publicly disregarding his program director's instructions, he joined its struggling rival, which ultimately surpassed WIOD in the ratings?

elements.title: Abdülhamid Han (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Turkey's newly acquired fourth drillship, Abdülhamid Han, is able to drill up to 12,200 m (40,000 ft) and in a maximum water depth of 3,665 m (12,024 ft)?

elements.title: Kyaymyin Mibaya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kyaymyin Mibaya was King Mindon's youngest, last and richest queen?

elements.title: guns don't kill people, people kill people (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to researchers including Stephen Hargarten, the slogan "guns don't kill people, people kill people" is "scientifically inaccurate"?

elements.title: Sean Hurson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the coin used by Gaelic football referee Sean Hurson bears his initials and was presented to him by one of his umpires shortly before the latter died?

elements.title: This Tender Land (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that This Tender Land is a retelling of Huckleberry Finn set in the 1930s and incorporating elements of Homer's Odyssey?

elements.title: Russell Strong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Russell Strong pioneered multiple techniques for liver transplantation, including splitting a donor liver between multiple recipients?

elements.title: 2022 National Arena League season (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the 2022 National Arena League season, a player hit a referee?
